meanings.definition: To make someone feel anxious or uneasy.
meanings.sent1: The loud noise seemed to unsettle the timid kitten.
meanings.sent2: The unexpected news about the test results can unsettle students.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a talking dog might unsettle some people.
meanings.sent4: The eerie silence in the abandoned house seemed to unsettle even the bravest explorers.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds looming overhead seemed to unsettle the picnic attendees.

meanings.sent1: The sudden burst of laughter from the audience seemed to unsettle the nervous speaker.
meanings.sent2: The unexpected guest's arrival can unsettle the host's carefully planned party.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to unsettle the calm park ranger.
meanings.sent4: The haunting melody seemed to unsettle the listeners' emotions.
meanings.sent5: The ghostly figure in the mirror appeared to unsettle the young child.

meanings.sent1: The strong wind can unsettle the fragile stack of papers on the desk.
meanings.sent2: The shaky ground beneath their feet began to unsettle the hikers.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy's antics seemed to unsettle the balanced vase.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected turn of events can unsettle even the most prepared individuals.
meanings.sent5: The turbulent waters started to unsettle the small boat.
